pages.text: $(bred)Summon Card$() is the link between players and creatures. Players can summon the corresponding creature by $(l)right click Summon Card on the ground$() while consuming $(byellow)SunNum$()(some cards is right-clicking the water surface). Currently, the only kind of creature that can be summoned by Summon Card is plant type $(m)(zombies may be added in later updates)$().

There is an unlocking mechanism for summon card, and many cards are not unlocked when the player's tree level is insufficient. Unlock paths are upgrades, challenge rewards or command.
Summon card is After player $(l)use card$() to summon a creature, $(bred)the creature will treat the player as its owner$().

pages.title: Enjoy Card
pages.text: $(l)Maximum stack size: 16$()$(br)Can't $(bpurple)enchant$()$(br)1s $(baqua)CoolDown$()$(br)Can only be used once$(br)$()The color of card frame is wood.

After 0.6 version, the card placement becomes more strict. Only 50 plants can be planted within 30 blocks, after that every 5 more sun cost will be doubled. Densely planting enchantment can slow down this situation.

The previous two pages introduced the difference between $(bred)Common Summon Cards and Enjoy Cards$(), and their acquisition is actually different. Common Cards are generally obtained by $(bred)crafting or purchase$(), while Enjoy Cards are often obtained by opening $(bred)treasure chests or lottery or finish invasion$().
